thread.title: Local Links: Mustangs defend title at Erin Hills
thread.title_full: Local Links: Mustangs defend title at Erin Hills | Dallas Morning News

author: Bill Nichols
title: Local Links: Mustangs defend title at Erin Hills
text:
SMU, led by senior Austin Smotherman's tie for second, defended its title at the Erin Hills Intercollegiate on Tuesday in Wisconsin.
Without reigning NCAA champion Bryson DeChambeau, who was not scheduled to play because of his busy summer, the Mustangs rode Smotherman's best performance of the season. He shot 5 under in the final round to finish 8-under 208.
As a team, the Mustangs shot 13 under with a three-round score of 851. They finished two strokes ahead of Oklahoma State, and six shots clear of UCLA in the 11-team field.
Juniors Alex Higgs and Andrew Buchanan finished in a six-way tie for eighth with a total score of 215 (-1). Higgs has three consecutive top-10s.
The Mustangs will compete in the Royal Oaks Intercollegiate hosted by Baylor on Oct. 26-27. Complete results and information: smumustangs.com.
Pampling charity event set for Old American
The Rod Pampling Golf Classic, benefiting the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation, is set for Monday at the Old American Golf Club in The Colony.
Pampling, an Australian and longtime Dallas-area resident, represents Old American with a logo on his tour bag and holds the course record (66). After winning the BMW Charity Pro-Am earlier this season, he finished 17th on the Web.com Tour money list to reclaim his PGA Tour card for 2016.
The tournament also marks the return of Old American. The course, designed by Tripp Davis and Dallas native Justin Leonard, recently reopened for member and limited outside play after being closed much of this year because of heavy rains and high water at Lake Lewisville.
A pre-tournament cocktail reception and live auction emceed by CBS Sports golf commentator Ian Baker-Finch and local television personality John Rhadigan will be held from 7-10 p.m. on Oct. 11 at the Glass Cactus at the Gaylord Texan. Tickets are $75 per person.
Auction items include a trip for two to Antigua, a TPC Sawgrass golf vacation, and a duck hunt with TV golf analyst David Feherty. Last year's event raised more than $140,000, increasing the overall funds generated to about $1 million. Information: oldamericangolfclub.com; 972-370-4653. For sponsorship opportunities, call Amy Van Vranken at 214-871-2222 or contact her via email at avanvranken@cff.org.
Briefly ...
The 24th Dennis Ewing Cup is scheduled for Nov. 13-15 at the Dallas Athletic Club. The invitational tournament draws some of the strongest mid-amateurs and seniors in Texas. The event features two-man best ball teams with a combined USGA handicap of 4 or less. Entries will be accepted through Oct 15th. Registration and information: dallasathleticclub.org; 972-279-6517.
Joshua Irving of Dallas lost in the quarterfinals of the U.S. Mid-Amateur Championship on the West Course of John's Island Club in Vero Beach, Fla. After reaching the quarterfinals with a 1-up victory over Joe Doody of Huntington Beach, Calif., Irving lost to Sammy Schmitz, 4 and 3, on Wednesday.
